data.title: Wow factor
data.text: Was here for the carnival cruise that came back to Alabama staff friendly room was super nice and huge and had private balcony i would go back anytime to this hotel very historic nice part of town its nice that carnival came back to mobile

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear cableguy2531,

Thank you for staying at the Battle House Hotel & Spa as part of your trip heading over for your Carnival Cruise!  I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you will visit Mobile and the hotel again real soon!  I know the city is excited about the Cruise Ship returning to Mobile too!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great stay
data.text: This is a great place to stay, great service by staff and clean comfortable rooms. I requested an early check in and was told by reservation staff to call when I arrived to see if a room was available.  I actually got into Mobile 2 hours earlier than planned and called anyway and my room wasn't available, but she asked if I minded being put in a suite instead of a regular room. I had a great stay and if I could fault anything about it, would have to be that the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling in a couple of places. I'm ready to go back and will, hopefully sooner than later.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear johnpY1654VC,

Thank you for taking the time to send in your feedback from your recent stay at the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  I appreciate your great comments and glad to hear you enjoyed your stay at the hotel and were able to check-in early to your room.  I hope you will make a return visit to the hotel real soon!

I appreciate your business and your feedback!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Downtown and Classy, visited for a wedding
data.text: We stayed here a Friday night and attended a wedding at the Battlehouse. It is downtown so there are lots of one way streets but it is still fairly easy to access this hotel. They have valet parking so plan that into your budget. We found room for our rental vehicle on the streets that worked with the posted signs. The building itself was lovely. The wedding ceremony didn't seem to have enough chairs. I don't know if they just didn't have enough chairs to begin with or they didn't know there'd be that many guests. We loved the view of the balcony where cocktail hour was held. We also loved the baby grand pianos in the hotel. Our room was clean and better than most we've stayed at. It had a soaking tub and shower. Large bathroom. Beautiful headboards on the beds. Free wifi but I didn't use it so I can't attest to the speed. They have a fitness center and spa but we didn't use those either. The have a restaurant so no free breakfast but there is somewhere to purchase breakfast. Lemon Lime water in the lobby. They also offer a military rate which was OH SO appreciated since it seems like an expensive hotel. Great time!

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear RussianAllAround,

I'm glad you enjoyed your visit to the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  I hope you also enjoyed the wedding that you attended.  Thank you for your great comments in regards to your hotel room, the cocktail reception, and the hotel overall.  Thank you for staying with us!
I do, however, apologize for any issues you encountered with the seating.  I hope that this was corrected for the event.  I hope you will have the opportunity to visit the hotel again in the near future and have more time to enjoy the amenities that the hotel has to offer!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Old World Classic
data.text: Elegant downtown hotel with classic lines, decor and style.  In a lovely part of town where you can walk to the convention center and lots of great eating spots.  The hotel appointments are classic and perfect, clean, elegant and delightful.  The staff is first class, welcoming and helpful.  If you are staying downtown Mobile, look no further.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear John-Cypress-Tx,

Thank you for sharing your experiences with me from your recent trip to the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  I appreciate your feedback and comments in regards to your overall stay and especially the hotel ambassadors.  I will make sure to share your review with the rest of the hotel team.  Thank you for being one of our guests!   We look forward to you visiting again next time your travels bring you back to Mobile.

Warm Regards!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful hotel
data.text: This is my favorite hotel in all of mobile. Almost as good as the grand hotel but way more to do walking distance from hotel. Great for meetings no matter how large. Great staff and very accommodating.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for making the Battle House Hotel & Spa your favorite hotel in Mobile!  I appreciate your business and your great comments about the hotel and its ambassadors.

You are very much appreciated!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great central location downtown, nice large rooms
data.text: The hotel can be fairly large, so you walk around a bit, but the rooms are very comfortable, the historic section is very nice, everyone is helpful.  The only downsides were the bar not opening until 4 pm or so, and the bistro feeling a little sterile.  Still a great place, I'd stay here again!

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Pigeonherder,

Thank you for staying with us at the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  I was a pleasure having you with us as our guest!  I hope to see you again at the hotel real soon!

I love your screen name too!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Mardi Grad Central
data.text: Great hotel during Mardi Grad or any other time. We stay ever year during our Mardi Grad celebration since hotel is on parade route. Historic hotel recently renovated and connected to a new tower, which is tallest in Alabama. Great rooms and bars.

data.title: Finest Hotel in Mobile
data.text: We really liked this place. On recommendation of friends we stayed here on our way home from Destin. We had a blast!!!! Amazing room with a great view of Mobile Bay!!! Lots of room, comfy bed, wow bathroom!!! I loved the breakfast buffet as well!! To top it off, they have a wicked spa that is just spectacular. Battle House has IT!!!!! Very impressive!! We will be back!! Lovely downtown location with lots of action nearby!!!

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Kevin P,

I loved your review of the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  Thank you for making this a stop on your way home from Destin!  I look forward to seeing you again real soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Grand hotel in heart of city
data.text: It is a lovely (updated) old hotel. Rooms were stately. We really loved the lobby bar with a piano player that encouraged singers to join in. And get a room on the concierge floor, worth the extra money, not only do you get a breakfast and happy hour but the 8th floor deck is amazing!!! We so loved to rooftop pool.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear 3deltas,

Thank you for staying at the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  I was glad to hear that you enjoyed your room, the lobby bar, the Club Lounge, and the 8th floor terrace.  

I hope you will visit the hotel again in the future!  

I appreciate your business!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Historic and Wonderful
data.text:
The Battle House should be your one and only choice for luxury accommodations in the port city of Mobile. This particular incarnation/renovation of the hotels long history was completed in 2007. It's a divine mixture of antebellum and modern with exceptional dining, bar, coffee service, and the works with some of the kindest check in staff you'll ever want to meet.
The history alone should enthrall you. It is here that Stephen Douglas learned he lost the presidency to Abraham Lincoln. The whispering arch in the second tier story of the lobby area has such an unusual acoustical effect, that you could stand on one side of it and whisper and have someone on the other end be able to hear. It is reported during war time activity that many a spy relied on this for daily information.
The Battle House is listed in the top 500 Hotels in the World. It is worthy of its listing.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear David30345,

Thank you for such a wonderful review of the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  I appreciate you taking the time to share your comments.  I will make sure that your comments are shared with the rest of the hotel ambassadors.  Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: They Just Nailed It!
data.text: We stayed in an accessible suite.  The bed, the views, the private balcony was perfect.  The check in staff could not have been more helpful.  Sally at the front desk should get a raise and a promotion!  The HVAC and the in-room amenities were great.  We used the mobile app for check-in and we recommend that.  We had fun at the whisper arch.  The hotel is in easy walking distance of anything you would want to do downtown.  The parking valets were great, even though there is not much space for valet service.  The Battle House will be our go-to in Mobile.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

I appreciate you taking the time to share your comments from your recent stay at the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  Thank you for mentioning Sally, one of our Front Desk Ambassadors, by name.  I will make sure to share your comments with her.  She will be excited to see that you mentioned her name in your review.  I look forward to a return visit from you real soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Football Weekend
data.text: The hotel was beautiful. I didn't think the location was great because there wasn't much in the area or walking distance in terms of night life or restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful when needed.

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Decadent luxury.
data.text: Valet parking on arrival at no extra charge!! Very warm welcome from the reception team and when they knew it was our first visit, we were upgraded to an executive suite. Beautiful building and a fantastic history, it was a pity that we were only stayed the one night. If we ever get back to this part of America this will be the hotel of choice.

owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful Hotel
data.text: We found that the Battle House Hotel was very charming. The lobby is stunning with its whispering arches. The pool on top of the building next door that includes the spa will make you think you have gone on a retreat. They also have tennis courts roof top and a driving range practice area. Our room was super spacious. The bed was comfy, the view of downtown at night is a delight. I love the deep soaking tub in the bathroom separate from the shower. All decor is tasteful. I will say walks are thin. We could hear our next door neighbors clear their throat and children playing. We would stay again. Note that the only parking is valet and it is $20 a day.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

I am glad you stopped by and stayed with us at the Battle House Hotel & Spa!  Thank you for your great comments in regards to the lobby, the Spa, and outdoor pool areas!

Hope to see you again real soon!

Thank you for staying with us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very nice!
data.text: Very nice stay with friendly service.    Was not able to utilize the SPA or pool, but they looked very nice.    My room was large and in excellent shape.   The lounge was active and a fun place for a beverage.  Walking distance to many cafes and restaurants

data.title: Beautiful hotel, elegant and centrally located
data.text:
My wife and I stayed here for two nights, with my in-laws in a nearby room.  This is probably the nicest chain hotel in the city, and of course it is right in the heart of downtown so food and drink is all around you.
PROS:  Elegant architecture, very comfortable rooms, soft beds, excellent views.  My in-laws had a corner room which was slightly larger, and we had a "normal" room facing the river.  The hotel has its own restaurant as well as a separate bar, so all basic needs are met.  We gave away our luggage at the curb and had it in our room within 15 minutes - pretty good considering how big the place is. 
CONS:  No self-parking, but the valet does a good job.  Obviously it is on the higher end of cost for the area as well.  My in-laws had an issue where a tub two floors up overflowed into their room, and they weren't able to be moved elsewhere.  The hotel did its best to clean up the mess though.  Also, one evening the restaurant was closed for a private event - which was unexpected.  However the hostess was great about giving us some recommendations which worked out perfectly.
I should note I also came here for a meeting a few weeks prior - the food is excellent.  
Overall this is a beautiful place to stay right in the middle of Mobile.  I would highly recommend it.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear MarkUSNA1998,

Thank you for visiting the Battle House Hotel & Spa.  I'm glad you and your in-laws enjoyed your stay overall.  I do apologize for the water leak into your in-laws room and that we were unable to move them due to occupancy levels.  I hope this does not deter them from visiting again.  Thank you for mentioning the efficiency of the valet team.  I will make sure to share with them your comments.  I will also pass on your comments in regard to the food.  

I appreciate your business and hope to see you again real soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely stay with just a few misgivings
data.text: Staff was welcoming and helpful. Received word after mobile check-in (in Mobile yet!) that I had been upgraded to a King suite due to Elite Marriott status. Room was spacious and comfortable, but couch bed was a bit lumpy) Huge shower separate from spacious tub was extremely appreciated. Minor irritation was performance of room keys that worked sometimes and in certain elevators but not others. Biggest disappointment was executive lounge which I found woefully inadequate. Granted it was the weekend, but if you are going to be a seven star property you have to do a better job with the food service in the lounge. When I told the front desk that I have had better breakfasts in Fairfield Inns I was given breakfast in the restaurant.  Property is gorgeous and well kept. Lots of fun places within walking distance to eat relax.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear GaryJA2015,

Thank you for using the Marriott Rewards App to check-in to the hotel.  I appreciate your comments and feedback in regards to the elevators and the Club Lounge.  I will make sure to follow-up on both items.   Thank you for bringing this to my attention.  

I do apologize for not meeting your expectations in this area and for the issues you encountered with the keys in the elevators.  

Thank you for staying at the Battle House Hotel & Spa!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: NICE
data.text: The hotel is beautiful.  Our rooms were nice.  The service was wonderful.  Someone responded immediately to our concerns.   We had a problem with our phone.  Someone came promptly and replaced it.  The gentleman that helped us with our luggage was very nice.  The breakfast on the 8th floor was just OKAY. The staff was nice and friendly at breakfast.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at The Battle House Renaissance Mobile Hotel & Spa, responded to this review

Thank you for your great review of the Battle House Hotel & Spa.  I appreciate your kind words and for mentioning the friendliness of the hotel ambassadors.  I do apologize that you had an issue with your phone.  I am glad to hear our Engineering Team were quick to respond.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fly drive
data.text: Beautiful hotel right near the quay but very close by a lovely area for restaurants and bars only 3 blocks walking distance. The hotel is very classy with huge well equipped rooms some with balcony . There is a spa gym and terrace pool ..fine dining also available and café and ballroom. Valet parking is currently  $21:60 per night .
